definition: Bush (name)/George H.W. Bush (1924-2018), US president 1988-1992/George W. Bush (1946-), US President 2000-2008
cloth/to declare/to announce/to spread/to make known
ten (used in fractions, writing checks etc)/assorted/miscellaneous

pinyin: Xin1 Han3 bu4 shi2 er3 zhou1

definition: Bushehr Province of south Iran, bordering on the Persian Gulf/Bushehr, port city, capital of Bushehr Province

sentences.english: It was the first-ever direct communication from Bush to Kim.
sentences.chinese: 這是布什和金正日之間的第一次直接溝通。

sentences.english: When Bush 41 talked about the economy, that was the beginning of the downward spiral.
sentences.chinese: 老布什談論經濟的時候，是經濟衰退的開始。

sentences.english: During Bush's tenure, the US economy experienced only 2% job growth.
sentences.chinese: 布什總統在任期間，美國經濟經歷了只有2%的增長。

sentences.english: Like Bush, Hoover is said to have become depressed.
sentences.chinese: 像布什一樣，據說胡佛變得鬱鬱寡歡。

sentences.english: Former President George W. Bush called Cronkite "an icon of American journalism."
sentences.chinese: 前總統布什稱克朗凱特爲“美國新聞業的偶像”。

sentences.english: And these findings are more favourable to Bush than more recent surveys.
sentences.chinese: 與很多近來調查相比，這些調查結果比較傾向於布什。

sentences.english: The political impact of what Bush and I were doing was uncertain.
sentences.chinese: 老布什和我在當時的口水仗有何政治影響，還不好說。

sentences.english: President Bush says he will veto that proposal.
sentences.chinese: 布什總統說他將否決這個建議。

sentences.english: President Bush, who escorted Mrs. Ford into the Cathedral, delivered the main eulogy.
sentences.chinese: 布什總統陪同福特夫人同往教堂並致悼詞。

sentences.english: W. Bush wanted to be president because it was his turn.
sentences.chinese: 布什想成爲總統我認爲是繼承父業吧。

sentences.english: President George Bush has had many insults hurled at him during his time in office.
sentences.chinese: 布什總統在其任內已經遭到過很多的辱罵了。

sentences.english: The admonition was prompted by Bush's rebuke of how China stifles free speech and religion.
sentences.chinese: 這個警告是對布什指責中國遏制言論和宗教信仰自由。

sentences.english: Out to a sleepy Flatbush Avenue.
sentences.chinese: 出來到了寂靜的弗拉特布什大道。

sentences.english: Mr Bush senior reduced Mr Dukakis to the candidate of card-carrying liberal elitists .
sentences.chinese: 老布什也曾經攻擊杜卡基斯是招牌式的自由派精英。

sentences.english: The Bush administration was out of gas, and the public was starved for leadership.
sentences.chinese: 布什政府已經黔驢技窮，公衆極度渴望強有力的領導。

sentences.english: Iraq is likely to be the focal point of the Bush legacy.
sentences.chinese: 伊拉克很可能是布什所遺留下的一個焦點。

definition: Clinton (name)/Bill Clinton (1946-), US Democratic politician, President 1993-2001/Hillary Rodham Clinton (1947-), US Democratic politician
Roosevelt (name)/Theodore Roosevelt (1858-1919), US President 1901-1909/Franklin D. Roosevelt (1882-1945), US President 1933-1945
Kennedy (name)/J.F. Kennedy (1917-1963), US Democrat politician, president 1961-1963
Dwight D. Eisenhower (1890-1969), US army general and politician, Supreme Allied Commander in Europe during World War II, US President 1953-1961
Hoover (name)/Herbert Hoover (1874-1964) US mining engineer and Republican politician, president (1929-1933)
Barack Obama (1961-), US Democrat politician, president 2009-2017
